sentences.english: Ten people, he threw down a dry well and buried alive.
sentences.chinese: 他把十個人投到一個枯井裏活埋。

sentences.english: She thinks of being buried alive again.
for his beautiful wife had been buried alive.
sentences.chinese: 他那美麗的愛人竟至是被活埋了。

sentences.english: This dinosaur was probably buried alive in a landslide that caught it off guard.
sentences.chinese: 這隻恐龍可能是在不注意時被山崩活埋。

sentences.english: Five Chinese prisoners of war are buried alive by their Japanese captor s just outside Nanking after the fall.
sentences.chinese: 在南京陷落後，五名中國戰俘被日軍在城外活埋。

sentences.english: She thinks of being buried alive again, of experiencing those 28 hours all over.
sentences.chinese: 她害怕再次被活埋，再次經歷那生不如死的28小時。

sentences.english: It is fear of being out of mobile contact.
sentences.chinese: 這是一種害怕被活埋的恐懼。

sentences.english: Very often they buried alive men who had engaged in the struggle for reduction of rents.
sentences.chinese: 他們經常是把那些參加過減租鬥爭的人活埋。

sentences.english: Cuddles plays baseball and ends up buried alive, drowned and crushed!
sentences.chinese: 可愛的小兔子在玩棒球，怎麼就被大傻鹿給活埋了？

sentences.english: The person who truly desires to die will not complain if buried standing up.
sentences.chinese: 一心求死的人即使活埋也不會抱怨。

definition: to be devoid of all humanity/inhuman/bestial
to hang (i.e. execute by hanging)/to strangle
